column5: According to the Globe and Mail, Hector Martinez, a 12 year old boy from Scarborough was fishing with his dad and uncle in Duffin's Creek yesterday afternoon with night crawlers and a float.  Just 10 minutes into fishing, little Hector felt a big tug on his little Ugly Stik rod and immediately called his dad and uncle for assistance.  "His pole was bent so far over," his uncle said, "that I knew it had to be a huge fish.  Hector's dad eventually netted the fish and to their astonishment, they couldn't believe the size of the steelhead.  When they weighed the steelhead on a Rapala scale, it read...  Ha!!! April Fools!  Be safe on the rivers with this rain guys
Hehe....I believed it until you said "According"....LOL.  Yep...the creeks are running very high!!  Stay safe everyone!
Ohhhhhh..man you had me believing for a minute,good-one steve,thanks for the laugh !!!!!!   happy april fools to you too....
Had me going up til the "Hector Martinez" part. I rarely see Swedish guys fishing our rivers...  Hookset.
I was thinkin......oh no not another croaker!!!
Got me "Hook line and sinker" if you'll excuse the pun
hah....you got me man ! completely forgot it was april fools! thx for the laughs!
hey man...no aprils fools allowed after noon
I FEEL USED !!!!.......half way through the post I was cursing myself for not hitting duffins, on the weekend  Nice....real nice !!!
yo man, that is funny...  gave me and james a good laugh...      can only imagine..LOL
haha i'm late but i got fooled!
Ok, April 1st is over, so finish the story, tell me more, how big was the fish. I need an adrenaline rush, something to get me through the next couple weeks.
I caught a fish so big one time that a snapshot of it weighed 7 lbs.

Haha, not so far fetched though. Nautifish loves to tell the story of her fishing at a local dam when a girl came out, her first time fishing, casted out a worm and bobber and hooked into a whopper steelhead. Beginner's luck to the max!
